intro: Acer loscosii, commonly known as the Loscosii maple, is a rare and ornamental species native to the mountainous regions of central China. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters before the leaves emerge in spring. Due to its limited distribution and unique foliage, it is highly sought after by horticulturists and botanists.
